verses.verse: Then Job<WH347> answered,<WH6030>
"I have heard<WH8085> many<WH7227> such<WH428> things;<WH7227> Sorry<WH5999> comforters<WH5162> are you all.<WH3605>
"Is there [no] limit<WH7093> to windy<WH7307> words<WH1697>? Or<WH176> what<WH4100> plagues<WH4834> you that you answer<WH6030>?
"I too<WH1571> could speak<WH1696> like you, If<WH3863> I were in your place.<WH8478> I could compose<WH2266> words<WH4405> against<WH5921> you, And shake<WH5128> my head<WH7218> at you.
"I could strengthen<WH553> you with my mouth,<WH6310> And the solace<WH5205> of my lips<WH8193> could lessen<WH2820> [your pain.]
"If<WH518> I speak,<WH1696> my pain<WH3511> is not lessened,<WH2820> And if I hold<WH2308> back,<WH2308> what<WH4100> has left<WH1980> me?
"But now<WH6258> He has exhausted<WH3811> me; Thou hast laid<WH8074> waste<WH8074> all<WH3605> my company.<WH5712>
"And Thou hast shriveled<WH7059> me up, It has become<WH1961> a witness;<WH5707> And my leanness<WH3585> rises<WH6965> up against me, It testifies<WH6030> to my face.<WH6440>
"His anger<WH639> has torn<WH2963> me and hunted<WH7852> me down,<WH7852> He has gnashed<WH2786> at me with His teeth;<WH8127> My adversary<WH6862> glares<WH3913> <WH5869> at me.
"They have gaped<WH6473> at me with their mouth,<WH6310> They have slapped<WH5221> me on the cheek<WH3895> with contempt;<WH2781> They have massed<WH4390> themselves against<WH5921> me.
"God<WH410> hands<WH5462> me over<WH5462> to ruffians,<WH5760> And tosses<WH3399> me into the hands<WH3027> of the wicked.<WH7563>
"I was at ease,<WH7961> but He shattered<WH6565> me, And He has grasped<WH270> me by the neck<WH6203> and shaken<WH9455> me to pieces;<WH9455> He has also set<WH6965> me up as His target.<WH4307>
"His arrows<WH7228> surround<WH5437> me. Without<WH3808> mercy<WH2550> He splits<WH6398> my kidneys<WH3629> open;<WH6398> He pours<WH8210> out my gall<WH4845> on the ground.<WH776>
"He breaks<WH6555> through<WH6555> me with breach<WH6556> after<WH5921> <WH6440> breach;<WH6556> He runs<WH7323> at me like a warrior.<WH1368>
"I have sewed<WH8609> sackcloth<WH8242> over<WH5921> my skin,<WH1539> And thrust<WH9414> my horn<WH7161> in the dust.<WH6083>
"My face<WH6440> is flushed<WH9147> from weeping,<WH1065> And deep<WH6757> darkness<WH6757> is on my eyelids,<WH6079>
Although<WH5921> there is no<WH3808> violence<WH2555> in my hands,<WH3709> And my prayer<WH8605> is pure.<WH2134>
"O earth,<WH776> do not cover<WH3680> my blood,<WH1818> And let there be no<WH408> [resting] place<WH4725> for my cry.<WH2201>
"Even<WH1571> now,<WH6258> behold,<WH2009> my witness<WH5707> is in heaven,<WH8064> And my advocate<WH7717> is on high.<WH4791>
"My friends<WH7453> are my scoffers;<WH9238> My eye<WH5869> weeps<WH1811> to God.<WH433>
"O that a man<WH1397> might plead<WH3198> with God<WH433> As a man<WH1121> <WH120> with his neighbor!<WH7453>
"For when a few<WH4557> years<WH8141> are past,<WH857> I shall go<WH1980> the way<WH734> of no<WH3808> return.<WH7725>
